CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03A02

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Oslo kommune v/ Omsorgsbygg Oslo KF

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Oslo kommune v/ Omsorgsbygg Oslo KF

SHORT_DESCR.P: Oslo kommune c/o Omsorgsbygg Oslo KF, hereafter referred to as the Contracting Authority / OBY / builder invites tenderers to an open tender contest for a “Partnering contract — Briskeby fire station”.

The project includes the total renovation of the current fire station built in 1963 (the main building), side buildings, housing sections, a practice tower and a workshop area including parking cover. The area contains a sand silo which the Contracting Authority wants to demolish. The buildings are located in Industrigata 3 and 3b-d. land Nos./title Nos. 213/174 and 213/442.
See the tender documentation with annexes.

Oslo kommune c/o Omsorgsbygg Oslo KF, hereafter referred to as the Contracting Authority / OBY / builder invites tenderers to an open tender contest for a “Partnering contract — Briskeby fire station”.

The project includes the total renovation of the current fire station built in 1963 (the main building), side buildings, housing sections, a practice tower and a workshop area including parking cover. The area contains a sand silo which the Contracting Authority wants to demolish. The buildings are located in Industrigata 3 and 3b-d. land Nos./title Nos. 213/174 and 213/442.
See the tender documentation with annexes.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Phases 2 and 3 are an option. There is an option for demolition works. Further details on the options are in the tender documentation and annexes.

SUITABILITY.P: Tenderers shall be a legally established company.
Foreign companies: Verification that the company is registered in a trade index or a register of business enterprises as prescribed by the law of the country where the company is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The tenderer must have sufficient economic and financial capacity to be able to implement the contract.
The contracting authority will obtain the credit appraisal / score. The rating will be carried out by a publicly certified credit rating institution.
The Contracting Authority reserves the right to obtain the annual accounts or other documentation if this is necessary to evaluate the requirement.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Qualification Requirement:
Tenderers shall have good capacity to fulfil the assignment.
Documentation requirement:
A statement of the tenderer's average workforce and the number of employees in the administrative management during the last 3 years.
Qualification Requirement:
Tenderers shall have good experience from equivalent assignments. Equivalent contracts means:
— renovation projects with a value of up to 50 000 000 NOK, excluding VAT, and higher,
— experience from turnkey contracts including partnering contracts, and
— experience with works for listed buildings.
Documentation requirement:

An overview of the most important deliveries in the last 5 years. The overview should state the value, type of contract, as well as time and place the work was performed, and indicate whether the works were professionally and properly completed.
Documentation of completed work is to be given in Annex D — “Template for Project Overview”.
Individual CVs are not requested under this qualification requirement.
Qualification Requirement:
The tenderer shall have a well-functioning quality assurance system that is relevant to the content of the contract.
Documentation requirement:
The Tenderer shall submit a description of their quality management system, hereunder the Tenderer’s quality assurance measures.
Documentation shall at least describe the following points:
a) the organisation’s quality policy and quality goals;
b) the work processes and work procedures that are relevant to the contract’s content;
c) methods that ensure the systematic measuring of customer satisfaction and continual improvement of performance.
Documentation can be requested.

Alternatively: The tenderer can submit certificates pertaining to the company’s quality management system issued by independent bodies confirming that the tenderer fulfils certain quality management standards, for example ISO 9001 or equivalent.
Qualification Requirement:

The Tenderer shall have an sufficient environmental management system adapted to the contract's content. The Tenderer shall substantiate environmental achievements / routines for the subjects procurements, energy, waste, transport and/or emission (only subjects relevant to the contract).
Documentation requirement:
Tenderers shall present a description of the tenderer’s environmental management measures.
The description shall include procedures and check-lists for the services offered in the contract, that show satisfactory environmental management of the deliveries / services.
The procedures and the check-lists shall show how the Tenderer meets the requirements for outer environment in accordance with the internal control regulation and pollution control act.
The Tenderers shall document that the system is regularly reviewed, and that they have an active system for deviation management and improvements.
Alternative 1:
If a tenderer is Eco-lighthouse certified, it is sufficient to enclose the certificate.
Alternative 2:
If the tenderer has ISO14001 certification (or equivalent), it is sufficient to enclose the certificate.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: The contract type is turnkey contract with partnering contract.

The type of contract is a partnering contract with a target sum based on NS 8407:2011, with amendments given in the contract form that is attached the tender documentation. See Annex 1 — Contract form NS 8407 for turnkey contracts. The responsibility for the engineering design service shall be given to the contractor. The engineering design shall be conducted as a partnering contract between the Contractor and the Contracting Authority. This means i.a. that the Contracting Authority has the right to influence solutions in regard prices and the execution. The partnering contract is also governed by the tender documentation’s Annex 2 — Guidelines for partnering contract.
